availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Josiah Horne (Shelby Co., TN, sheriff, magistrate, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Shelby County, Tennessee, sheriff, magistrate, and justice of the peace. Georgia native. Married to Susan Horne. Father of Louisa Horne, James Horne, Frances Horne, Susan Horne, Apie Horne, Henry Horne, and Edward Horne. Sheriff in Shelby County, Tennessee, in 1850. Magistrate in Memphis in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Shelby County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Shelby County, District 5, p. 83B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Shelby County, Memphis Ward 2, p. 72.
KYR-0001-022-0004.
